greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of bases in which both n and the reversal of n are 3-digit numbers.
example: a(36)=3 since 36 is 3-digit number in bases 4,5,6 and 63 is 3-digit number in bases 4,5,6,7 such that we have 3 common bases.
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, May 30 2011
